timeline.bodyText:
This is completely redundant as the Listener which calls this method already checks if it is cancelled.
Also missing brackets.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText:
This is completely redundant as the Listener which calls this method already checks if it is cancelled.
Also missing brackets.

No it doesn't
replies.author: LinoxGH

replies.bodyText: It only does a material check.
replies.author: LinoxGH

LinoxGH

replies.bodyText: Ok just looked up, I was wrong.
replies.author: LinoxGH

timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText: Can I ask why were even changing this?
replies.author: svr333

replies.bodyText: The bug was about this running AFTER HIGHEST, which should not be done anyway. By moving it TO HIGHEST we basically didn't fix the issue but rather let randomness decide.
replies.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText: In theory events should try to run on NORMAL unless there is a valid reason not to, due to this being dependent on some things to process first, there is a point to be made to move it to HIGH but HIGHEST is definitely too late.
replies.author: TheBusyBiscuit
